intro: Varronia nashii, commonly known as the Nash varronia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, palmate leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
